comments.commentBody: Okay, most of the comments of the arsenal supporters are just plain emotional. Bad refereeing calls happen all the time. Yes, the red card to Van Persie was petty, but so was the red card that was NOT given to Alex Song in the first leg and the legitimate Messi goal that WAS disallowed in the first leg. On the whole, there is a need for better refereeing, but arsenal fans should stop hiding behind that. The team is just not that good, as evidenced by defeat to Birmingham, no trophies since 2004 and most likely another defeat from the hands of Manchester United tomorrow in the quarter finals of the FA cup (smiles, jk, no hard feelings). Arsene needs to strengthen his team and stop making excuses
No Alaia?  I'm sad.

MissG...they actually don't think much of anything is "new". LOL...everything seems to remind them of Ghesquiere's Balenciaga or Prada/Miu Miu! In some ways, their tastes are surprisingly conservative in terms of styles and designers, but they mostly think in terms of mix and matching disparate looks to their own personal tastes. Tho they are hypercritical of cohesion in observing collections, they have very eclectic personal tastes.

Personally I don't care about old or new, I'm interested in how the designer combines elements and whether or not I think it works. For example, I'd have liked to have seen the fully fashioned stockings in a context outside of the late 40s. Marras' collection was inspired by his mother's style from that era, but how would he envision such a SEEMING anachronism paired w/ contemporary clothing? Considering that there are a small but loyal group of daily wearers as well as a much larger group of occasional wearers....there's definitely inspo out there for presentation in a contemporary context!

One more thing...the shoes at Prada. It'll take a brave soul to wear them, but they have a serious cool factor for the daring!

artpup….it never ceases to amaze me at how many gems are buried in MJ’s shows. The styling of his shows rarely give the credit due to the pieces. IOW the parts are definitely greater than the whole!

MissG…pleated/cuffed pants have been back for sometime actually. I've been seeing them on the runways for a few years now. I only thought “Charlie Chaplin” w/ Chanel because it was the obvious that the stylist was going there. The small-large disparate layering wasn’t accidental. I didn’t think that when looking at Armani tho….I thought his Emporio show was the strangest trip on the circuit this time out. I wonder who will want a dress w/ a HUGE print of his face on it?! LOL

Anyway, I doubt these pleated/cuffed pants will make much of a comeback tho….too many women are convinced that the flat crotch-low slung look makes them look slimmer! Not to my eyes, but hey….

Easy: Look #9 in Tess Giberson's New York presentation. A pair of cropped black wool trousers under a black trompe l'oeil hooded anorak (constructed to look as though there was a satin-back vest tossed over it), topped by a Mongolian lamb scarf. The coat is just the perfect blend of a classic shape reworked to feel modern (and the vest makes it feel unique) and the proportions of the three pieces together was just right.

Lauren
www.thefashioninformer.com

What I took away from this very confusing and almost off-putting series of collections was not any particular cut or silhouette, although that Miu Miu black pencil skirt in the slide show looks like a surefire retail bombshell to my eye. What interested me was the reliance on extremely sensuous, luxurious, beyond beautiful fabrics to obscure a general lack of direction. Fabric was the story.

One other observation: The fact that the Calvin Klein men's collection, which for the first time in years brought about a total re-think of menswear and will be influential for years to come, somehow eluded the press. Take another look at the cut of those pants. These are not just baggy, slouchy trousers. The drape, from the high narrow waists to the graceful fall of the widening legs while maintaining a smooth unsullied line is uncanny and something completely new. They seem to defy the laws of physics. The world has been waiting for suits to get sexy again, and now it's happened.
